subject: Web3
title: Delegation in DAOs
description: A quick, practical guide to Delegation in DAOs.

hook.text: Most people don't have time to vote on every proposal. Delegation lets you give your voting power to someone else.

buildup.text: DAOs like Uniswap and ENS allow token holders to delegate votes to trusted community members.

discovery.text: Delegates study proposals, engage in discussions, and vote on behalf of hundreds or thousands of token holders.

twist.text: Delegation concentrates power. A handful of active delegates often control the majority of voting power.

climax.text: DAOs rediscovered representative democracy. The same structure they tried to escape keeps reappearing.

punchline.text: DAOs tried to escape representatives. They reinvented them.

quiz.question: What does delegation in DAOs allow?
options: Giving your voting power to a trusted community member
